snippet: Even as it emerged that Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. had apologized to President Obama for hastening his backing of gay marriage, Mr. Obama’s campaign sought to capitalize on it.
abstract: Pres Obama's campaign seeks to capitalize on his announced support of same-sex marriage, even as reports emerge that Vice Pres Joseph R Biden Jr apologized to Obama for bringing the issue to a head; Mitt Romney steers clear of the topic as he campaigns, underscoring Republican caution over the shifting politics of the gay marriage debate.

byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and JEFF ZELENY
byline.contributor: Mark Landler reported from Washington, and Jeff Zeleny from Omaha. Reporting was contributed by Mark Leibovich, Michael D. Shear and Jennifer Steinhauer from Washington, Jackie Calmes from Seattle, Jeremy Peters and Michael Barbaro from New York, and Nicholas Confessore from Las Vegas.

lead_paragraph: Even as it emerged that Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. had apologized to President Obama for hastening his backing of gay marriage, Mr. Obama’s campaign sought to capitalize on it.

headline.seo: Obama Campaign Tries to Capitalize on Marriage Issue
headline.main: Obama Campaign Pushes the Issue of Gay Marriage
headline.print_headline: Obama Campaign Pushes the Issue Of Gay Marriage

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
